lines.text:
[on the perfect proposal]
Look, I guarantee there'll be tough times. I guarantee that at some point, one or both of us is gonna want to get out of this thing. But I also guarantee that if I don't ask you to be mine, I'll regret it for the rest of my life, because I know, in my heart, you're the only one for me.
Is there one 'right' person for everyone?
No, but I think attraction is mistaken for rightness.
I wanted to tell you why I run - sometimes ride - away from things.
Does it matter?
I think so.
[takes a deep breath]

When I was walking down the aisle, I was walking toward somebody who didn't have any idea who I really was. And it was only half the other person's fault, because I had done everything to convince him that I was exactly what he wanted. So it was good that I didn't go through with it because it would have been a lie. But you - you knew the real me.
Yes, I did.
I didn't. And you being the one at the end of the aisle didn't just fix that.
[Ike and Maggie have just kissed]

[to Maggie]
If you were imagining me, you did great.
[turns to Ike]
What the hell were YOU doing?
I'm sorry, Bob. She kissed me back.
I kissed him back.
Yeah, I caught that. Want to tell me how long this has been going on?
About a minute...?
A little longer for me.

[smiles]
Really?
What do you expect me to say to this?
How about - "I hope you'll be very happy together"?
[Bob punches Ike in the face]
I hope you'll be very happy together.
I am profoundly and irreversibly screwed up.

[Ike has just seen Maggie in the mirror in his apartment]
Hello Ike.
Don't tell me, my *doorman* is one of your many admirers.
I'm making friends with your cat. Is it okay that I'm here?
I don't have much choice in the matter, do I? But, I can't speak for Italics.
[points at Italics the cat]
*Traitor*.
[Maggie has just left her groom standing at the altar, and has jumped aboard a FedEx truck]
Where is she going?
30 tomorrow.
Benedict.
Arnold.

I love Eggs Benedict, I hate every other kind. I hate big weddings with everybody staring. I'd like to get married on a weekday while everybody's at work. And when I ride off into the sunset, I want my own horse.
Should I be writing this down?

[Mrs. Whittenmeyer refuses to sell a wedding gown to Maggie]
You sell wedding dresses, right?
Yes, I've been selling wedding gowns for thirty-five years.
Wonderful! Because we are here to buy one! But not just any one.
[points to a gown in the window]
She wants "that" one!
It's a thousand dollars!
Listen, Aunt Bea! Conversation has never worked for me, let's try "visual."
[jumps into the window and pulls the mannequin down, knocking its wig off]
We're buying the dress! And anything else she wants!

[about Ike]
I like his tight butt.
Grandma!
Well, I do.
I love you, Homer Eisenhower Graham. Will you marry me?
I... I've got to think about this a little bit.
Good. I was hoping you'd say that.

[laughing]
You were not!
I was, because if you said "yes" right away, then I wouldn't get to say this next part, and I've been practicing.
[Maggie sits down, clears her throat]
Ready?
I'm listening.
I guarantee there'll be tough times. I guarantee that at some point, one or both of us is going to want get out. But I also guarantee...
[starts to cry]
...that if I don't ask you to be mine, I'll regret it for the rest of my life. Because I know in my heart... you're the only one for me.
Hey, don't knock drunks in bars! It means they're not out driving.
You're a cynical, exploitive, mean-hearted creep who wouldn't know real love if it bit him in the armpit.
A girl can't get married in flannel!
[Ike's voice on his answering machine]
Hi, leave a message after the beep. If you want to send me a fax, then buy me a fax machine.
Bless me Father for I have sinned. My last confession was... well. Anyway, I have sorta a technical question. I've been having bad thoughts, really bad thoughts.
Of an impure nature?
No, No, I want to destroy this man's life, career everything. I want revenge. Now on a sins scale how bad is that? Can I Hail Mary my way out of that?
SHAZAM! I think I'm in Mayberry.
I'm thinking of changing back to my maiden name.
Can you still remember it?
Gill, I am really afraid of needles, but that doesn't make me a bad person...
Look...
[Gill shows her his rose tattoo on his chest]

[in a surfer-dude voice]
Look, look! I think this man is heart broken!
Well, there is one thing that brings warmth to my heart.
[pause]
Duckbill platypus.
No... that's only funny at Camp Birchwood in the tent at three in the morning and it's raining and my leg is the pole! That's the only time that's funny.
Let's just give it a try.

[while fighting with her veil]
Who makes these things?
Calm down. The veil is not attacking you.
Have you heard my husband's morning show? "Wake Up With Flem?"
What is she doing?
Uh, she's being the "bell" instead of the "ball".

[reading Ike's notes]
"How does she get all those guys to propose? She's not even that beautiful." Bite me, paper boy!

[wistfully]
Always a bride, never a bridesmaid!
Do you think I flirt with Cory?
Good morning to you, too. You look good.
Thank you. Do you think I flirt with Cory?
Yes.
I don't mean it.
I know. I think sometimes you just sort of spaz-out with random excess flirtation energy and it just lands on anything male that moves.
On anything male that moves? As opposed to anything male that doesn't move?
Like certain kinds of coral.
Hi, I'm Cindy, Maggie's unmarried cousin.
I'm Peggy Fleming. Not the ice-skater.
